The use of interval mathematics to solve non-linear problems is an attractive alternative to traditional real-number techniques. It was demonstrated in a previous paper [Stradi, B., Haven, E., 2005. Optimal investment strategy via interval arithmetic. International Journal of Theoretical and Applied Finance 8(2), 185–205] that interval arithmetic in the form of the Interval-Newton Generalized Bisection (IN/GB) method is effective in solving highly non-linear problems. In this paper we solve a rational expectations models with the help of the IN/GB method. This method is capable of (i) rapidly eliminating no solution sections of the multidimensional space and (ii) concentrate computational efforts on those areas of multidimensional space where there may be a solution.</dc:description><dc:date>
